abstracts.cdata!:
The goal of the Administrative Capacity
            Building Project is to improve the performance of the
            administration and enable it to implement key strategic
            choices of the Government of Burkina Faso (GoBF). This
            restructuring paper seeks for the extension of closing date
            for the project to August 31, 2011. This will be the first
            extension of the project closing date.  The project
            achievements to date include: i) the implementation of HR
            management de-concentration; ii) the increase of civil
            service performance, through implementation of the 1998
            evaluation policy; iii) the restructuring of the ministry of
            economy and finance to improve its internal efficiency; and
            iv) the strengthening of public expenditures management
            de-concentration. The extension is necessary to complete the
            extension of the computerized HR management system to line
            ministries in the capital city and to extend the
            computerized pay system to the regions. With the completion
            of these activities the processing of the administrative and
            financial decisions on staff careers will be done on a
            timely manner and the staff located in the provinces will no
            longer have to leave their work place for administrative
            reasons. This extension will also be used to elaborate the
            decentralization strategy.
